required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on February 08, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Vitamin D Level and Supplement on SLE Patients During COVID-19 Pandemic
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Vitamin D Level and Supplement on SLE Patients During COVID-19 Pandemic

brief_summary.textblock: Aim of the work Impact of serum vit D level in SLE patients with COVID-19 disease on severity of infection, duration of COVID-19 disease course, fatigue development as a complication for both SLE and COVID-19 and assess impact of prior chloroquine on COVID-19 disease outcomes Patients and methods 38 SLE patients previously diagnosed and on different lines of lupus management. Participants were presented to chest outpatient clinic and emergency hospital, Mansoura University with manifestation suggesting COVID-19 infection. Serum vit D was measured in serum by ELISA.

detailed_description.textblock:
Primary objective: assess the impact of serum vit D level in SLE patients with COVID-19 disease on severity of infection and pandemic treatment outcome.
Secondary objectives:
- Effect of serum vit D level in SLE patients on duration of COVID-19 disease course and fatigue development as a complication for both SLE and COVID-19
- Impact of prior chloroquine on COVID-19 disease outcomes
- Correlation of serum vit D level with different laboratory investigations at time of COVID-19 outbreak

primary_outcome.measure: Level of serum vitamin D in SLE infected with COVID-19
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of serum vit D level (ng/ml)

secondary_outcome.measure: Vitamin D level with COVID-19 severity
secondary_outcome.description: Level of serum vitamin D (ng/ml) in mild, moderate and sever COVID-19

other_outcome.measure: Impact of serum vit D level in SLE patients on duration of COVID-19 disease course
other_outcome.description: serum vit D level (ng/ml) in SLE patients and time to recovery (number of days) from COVID-19

other_outcome.measure: Impact of prior chloroquine on COVID-19 disease outcomes
other_outcome.description: Can prior chloroquine in SLE patients affect outcome of COVID-19 infection (recovery or die)

other_outcome.measure: Serum vitamin D level and development of fatigue
other_outcome.description: Basal vitamin d level (ng/ml) in SLE patients diagnosed with recent COVID-19 and development of fatigue after recovery from COVID-19 infection

other_outcome.measure: Correlation of serum vit D level with different laboratory investigations at time of COVID-19 outbreak
other_outcome.description: Correlation of serum vit D level (ng/ml) with ESR, CRP, serum Lymphocyte count, Ferritine, D-dimer at time of COVID-19 diagnosis

arm_group.description: SLE patients were presented to chest outpatient clinic and emergency hospital, Mansoura University with manifestation suggesting COVID-19 infection. Vit D was measured in serum by ELISA. Vit D was added to anti COVID-19.

intervention.description: Impact of serum vit D level in SLE patients with COVID-19 disease on severity of infection, duration of COVID-19 disease course, fatigue development as a complication for both SLE and COVID-19 and assess impact of prior chloroquine on COVID-19 disease outcomes

biospec_descr.textblock: Serum sample for Vitamin D level by ELISA

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- - SLE patients previously diagnosed
- Patients are not suffering from malignancies.
- Patients have no organ failure nor uncontrolled medical illness.
- Recent COVID-19 infection
Exclusion Criteria:
- - Pregnant, lactating females
- Concurrent malignancies
- Patients with other autoimmune disease
